topics.name: Process vs Program
topics.explanation: A program is a passive set of instructions, while a process is an active execution of a program.
key_points: Process contains memory and execution state

topics.name: Process States
topics.explanation: Processes move through different execution stages.
topics.example: A process waiting for I/O moves to waiting state.

topics.name: Context Switching
topics.explanation: Switching CPU execution from one process to another.

topics.name: CPU Scheduling - FCFS
topics.explanation: First Come First Serve scheduling executes processes in arrival order.

topics.name: Round Robin
topics.explanation: Each process gets a fixed time slice called quantum.
